snippet: Ryan Harrow of Georgia State and Trae Golden of Georgia Tech might end up being among the last players granted exceptions to an N.C.A.A. rule that prevents transfers from playing right away.
abstract: Ryan Harrow of Georgia State and Trae Golden of Georgia Tech may end up being among the last basketball players granted exceptions to an NCAA rule that prevents transfers from playing right away; NCAA is weighing whether to eliminate the wavers, which are granted to players who have local family members coping with a serious medical condition, in favor of tacking an extra year on the back end of a transfer's eligibility.
lead_paragraph: Ryan Harrow of Georgia State and Trae Golden of Georgia Tech might end up being among the last players granted exceptions to an N.C.A.A. rule that prevents transfers from playing right away.

headline.main: A Bigger Role for Relatives in N.C.A.A. Transfers
headline.print_headline: Bigger Role for Relatives in College Transfers
